messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New England conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/28/03 9:51:09 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Before you decide on camp vs hotel you should think about every aspect of it. Like
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/28/03 9:51:09 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
treegoddess@... writes:

> Just to throw in my two cents.... I have no preference what season it's
> planned in because we'll be staying in a hotel. DH does *not* camp. LOL
>
>

Before you decide on camp vs hotel you should think about every aspect of it.
Like transportation, food, At a lot of camps with cabins you need to bring
your own linens, Air conditioning?, availability of audio visual equipment
that you might need. Vendors tents/areas. Trash. Do you need to clean up
the camp before you leave. Sweep/mop/clean toilets etc.

Pam G.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: New England conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/28/2003 10:04:56 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Just to clarify...when I said a camp I meant a nice Children s camp with cabins and beds
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/28/2003 10:04:56 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Just to throw in my two cents.... I have no preference what season it's
> planned in because we'll be staying in a hotel. DH does *not* camp. LOL
>

Just to clarify...when I said "a camp" I meant a nice Children's camp with
cabins and beds and hot showers. I personally prefer to sleep indoors most of
the time, particularly when I am going to be encountering other people.

Kathryn
